output: On November 17th, 2024, a football match took place at Estádio Onésio Brasileiro Alvarenga in Goiânia between Vila Nova and Ituano as part of Serie B's regular season. The game ended with Ituano winning over Vila Nova by a score of 4-3 after extra time, which lasted for an additional 12 minutes following a tie at halftime (2-2). José Aldo from Ituano scored the winner in added time and Gabriel Falcão provided assists to both regular goals. During the match, there were multiple substitutions made by both teams: Vila Nova had five substitutes on field while Ituano used six different players throughout the game including two additional ones during extra time. The referee for this match was Wagner do Nascimento Magalhaes and several yellow cards were issued to each team's players, with one red card given in added time: Richard from Vila Nova and Leozinho from Ituano.

On November 17, 2024, a National League match took place at Bluewater Stadium in Napier between Napier City Rovers and Auckland City as part of Round 8 within New Zealand'se National Football league. The game started with both teams having equal scores throughout the first half (halftime) - zero each for both sides. In extra time, no additional goals were scored by either team. During the match, there was a series of substitutions made; Napier City Rovers had five substitutes come in at 46', 61', 65' twice, and again on 78'. Auckland City also saw four changes with players coming in from minutes 61', 65', 'substituting D. Manickum and M. Bevan among others. The match concluded when S. Ukich scored a goal for Auckland City at the 90th minute, leading to their victory over Napier City Rovers with an overall score of 1-0 in full time.

On November 17, 2024, during the USL Championship Conference Finals at Patriots Point Stadium in Mount Pleasant, South Carolina, Rhode Island and Charleston Battery faced off in a closely contested match. The game started with no goals scored by either team until half-time when Rhode Island managed to score one goal through N. Dossantos' own effort during an extra time opportunity at the 43rd minute, leading into their first substitution involving Z. Herivaux and J. Williams entering as substitutes for M. Doyle and C. Holstad respectively. The second half saw Charleston Battery equalize with a goal from N. Markanich in the 52nd minute followed by another normal score from J. Torres shortly after, increasing their lead to two goals-to-one against Rhode Island at halftime's end. Substitutions continued throughout both teams as they made tactical changes; for instance, Charleston Battery brought in E. Ycaza and P. Saydee while J. Brito substituted C. Holstad on the 76th minute. However, Rhode Island managed to score again through N. Fuson with assistance from C. Holstad at the 53rd minute of play. The match concluded in fulltime extra time when Charleston Battery maintained their lead after another substitution involving K. Twumasi for Z. Herivaux and ended up winning, despite Rhode Island's efforts to catch up with assists from C. Holstad and M. Doyle respectively.

On November 17, 2024, a Primera Division football match took place at Estadio Óscar Alberto Quiteño in Santa Ana between FAS and Alianza teams of El Salvador's Primera Division league (ID#370). The game was part of Round Apertura - 21.

On November 17, 2024, a Primera Division football match took place at Estadio Cacique Diriangén in Diriamba between teams Diriangén and Jalapa with an elapsed time of just under ten minutes. The game started quickly as both sides made substitutions within the first minute; by halftime, only six goals had been scored entirely from home shots for Diriangén against no away goals for Jalapa. In a remarkable turnaround during extra time which lasted one minute and forty seconds, all five substitutes on each side entered play without scoring or assisting in any way. The match concluded with full-time scores remaining tied at 6-0 in favor of Diriangén after they scored another goal as the ninth entry for their tally within extra time duration. Notably, throughout these events, referee L. Rocha oversaw a swiftly finished game that lasted just under an hour with no penalties being awarded.

On November 17th, 2024, a football match took place at Estadio Jorge Calero Suárez in Metapán between Isidro Metapán and Once Municipal as part of Primera Division Apertura - Round 21. The game ended with a draw, both teams scoring two goals each; notable events included own goal by G. Córdoba from Isidro Metapán at the 14th minute and normal goal for Once Municipal's J. Williams shortly afterward. Substitutions were made throughout the match: D. Cetré (Isidro Metapán), E. Flores, I. Esquivel, Diego Gregori, C. Aguilar from Isidro Metapán; A. Ortega and K. Malcolm for Once Municipal at 56', 'subst' minutes followed by J. Gil, then E. Gónzalez with the final substitution made by I. Portillo (E. Vásquez) both sides swapped players five times in total during regulation time plus extra time which lasted an additional two minutes and was not utilized for any further goals or significant events as per provided data summary. The match, officiated by referee R. Morales, concluded after 90 full-time minutes with a final score of Isidro Metapán 2-2 Once Municipal in what appears to have been an evenly contested game without penalties being awarded or scored during the extra time period. The event occurred within the context of Primera Division's season for El Salvador, specifically round Apertura - Round 21.

On November 17, 2024, Birkenhead United and Coastal Spirit faced off at Shepherds Park in Auckland during Round 8 of New Zealand's National League season. The match concluded with a full-time score of 2-1 in favor of Birkenhead United after both teams had made substitutions throughout the game, including three for Coastal Spirit and two for Birkenhead United at different times. Notably, during halftime, Coastal Spirit managed to equalize when A. Steinwascher scored a goal from open play. In the second half, M. Patterson of Birkenhead United extended their lead with another normal goal before D. Bunch and C. Hughes made substitutions for further reinforcements on the field. The match ended in extra time where Birkenhead United secured its win through a penalty by M. Patterson after several strategic player changes, including three substitutes from Coastal Spirit.
